Business_Rule_Plain_English: Use Form 1040 as the default individual return; offer Form 1040-SR only if the taxpayer was born before January 2, 1961.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) (i1040gi.pdf) – filing forms and due date; Publication 17 (2025) – general filing rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Set the standard filing deadline for calendar-year 2025 returns to April 15, 2026, and flag late-filing risk if submission occurs after that date.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) (i1040gi.pdf) – filing forms and due date; Publication 17 (2025) – general filing rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: If the taxpayer is a nonresident alien or dual‑status alien, route to Form 1040‑NR workflow and apply alien-specific filing rules.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) (i1040gi.pdf) – filing forms and due date; Publication 17 (2025) – general filing rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: If the return is e-filed, do not generate mailing instructions; if paper-filed, generate the correct mailing address guidance from the current instructions.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) (i1040gi.pdf) – filing forms and due date; Publication 17 (2025) – general filing rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Treat a fiscal-year filer as an exception and require explicit tax year start/end months rather than assuming Jan 1–Dec 31.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) (i1040gi.pdf) – filing forms and due date; Publication 17 (2025) – general filing rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Trigger an extension-path workflow when taxpayer requests more time; record whether payment is being made with the extension to reduce late-payment penalty exposure.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) (i1040gi.pdf) – filing forms and due date; Publication 17 (2025) – general filing rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Require explicit state of residency and source-income flags if the taxpayer lived abroad or moved states (for federal return this affects residency/foreign income worksheets and info reporting).
Primary_IRS_Authority: Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) (i1040gi.pdf) – filing forms and due date; Publication 17 (2025) – general filing rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Require the taxpayer to choose exactly one filing status and validate consistency with marital status and household facts for the year.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) (i1040gi.pdf) – filing forms and due date; Publication 17 (2025) – general filing rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Block e-filing if required identity fields are missing (name/SSN/ITIN/DOB).
Primary_IRS_Authority: Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) (i1040gi.pdf) – filing forms and due date; Publication 17 (2025) – general filing rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Require explicit signature/authorization (self-sign, spouse sign, or paid preparer authorization) prior to final submission.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) (i1040gi.pdf) – filing forms and due date; Publication 17 (2025) – general filing rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Determine whether someone can claim the taxpayer (or spouse, if filing jointly) as a dependent; if yes, compute the standard deduction using the dependent worksheet rather than the main table.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) – Standard Deduction section and worksheets; Topic No. 551 – Standard deduction

Business_Rule_Plain_English: If married filing separately and the spouse itemizes deductions, set the taxpayer’s standard deduction to zero.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) – Standard Deduction section and worksheets; Topic No. 551 – Standard deduction

Business_Rule_Plain_English: If the taxpayer is a dual-status alien for the year, set the standard deduction to zero.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) – Standard Deduction section and worksheets; Topic No. 551 – Standard deduction

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Use the standard deduction amounts embedded in the 2025 Form 1040 instructions (Single/MFS $15,750; MFJ $31,500; HOH $23,625) unless an exception applies.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) – Standard Deduction section and worksheets; Topic No. 551 – Standard deduction

Business_Rule_Plain_English: If the taxpayer (or spouse) is born before January 2, 1961, increase the standard deduction using the age/blindness boxes and the standard deduction chart.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) – Standard Deduction section and worksheets; Topic No. 551 – Standard deduction

Business_Rule_Plain_English: If the taxpayer is blind, increase the standard deduction using the chart/worksheet; if both age 65+ and blind, apply both increments as allowed by the worksheet logic.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) – Standard Deduction section and worksheets; Topic No. 551 – Standard deduction

Business_Rule_Plain_English: If the taxpayer has a net qualified disaster loss and elects the increased standard deduction, apply the disaster-loss add-on logic as defined in the instructions.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) – Standard Deduction section and worksheets; Topic No. 551 – Standard deduction

Business_Rule_Plain_English: When computing dependent standard deduction, treat earned income as wages/salaries/tips and taxable scholarships (per worksheet definition) and follow the worksheet min/max constraints.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) – Standard Deduction section and worksheets; Topic No. 551 – Standard deduction

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Prevent simultaneous use of the dependent worksheet and the age/blind chart when the instructions require the dependent worksheet instead.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) – Standard Deduction section and worksheets; Topic No. 551 – Standard deduction

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Record which exception caused a nonstandard standard-deduction outcome (dependent, spouse itemizes, dual-status, age/blindness, disaster).
Primary_IRS_Authority: Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) – Standard Deduction section and worksheets; Topic No. 551 – Standard deduction

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Do not allow EIC unless the taxpayer has earned income and meets all eligibility rules summarized in Pub. 596.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 596 (2025) – Earned Income Credit rules; Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) – credits & schedules references; Publication 970 – education benefits overview

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Reject EIC when filing status is married filing separately unless a specific statutory exception is met and supported by Pub. 596 rules.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 596 (2025) – Earned Income Credit rules; Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) – credits & schedules references; Publication 970 – education benefits overview

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Require either a qualifying child test pass or the ‘no qualifying child’ rules to be satisfied (age, residency, and other conditions) before calculating EIC.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 596 (2025) – Earned Income Credit rules; Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) – credits & schedules references; Publication 970 – education benefits overview

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Validate qualifying child relationship test (child must be related in an allowed way) before treating them as a qualifying child for EIC.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 596 (2025) – Earned Income Credit rules; Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) – credits & schedules references; Publication 970 – education benefits overview

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Validate qualifying child age test (child must meet age criteria) before treating them as a qualifying child for EIC.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 596 (2025) – Earned Income Credit rules; Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) – credits & schedules references; Publication 970 – education benefits overview

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Validate qualifying child residency test (child lived with taxpayer in the U.S. for the required period) before treating them as a qualifying child for EIC.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 596 (2025) – Earned Income Credit rules; Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) – credits & schedules references; Publication 970 – education benefits overview

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Disallow EIC if the taxpayer (or spouse, if filing jointly) does not have a valid SSN when required by Pub. 596.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 596 (2025) – Earned Income Credit rules; Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) – credits & schedules references; Publication 970 – education benefits overview

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Apply investment income limitation logic as required by Pub. 596; if exceeded, disallow EIC.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 596 (2025) – Earned Income Credit rules; Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) – credits & schedules references; Publication 970 – education benefits overview

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Support the option to use prior-year earned income for EIC only if the law/instructions for the year allow it and required conditions are met (store election flags).
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 596 (2025) – Earned Income Credit rules; Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) – credits & schedules references; Publication 970 – education benefits overview

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Create a substantiation checklist for EIC (SSNs, school/medical records, lease, etc.) because EIC is audit-prone; surface recordkeeping requirements from Pub. 596.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 596 (2025) – Earned Income Credit rules; Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) – credits & schedules references; Publication 970 – education benefits overview

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Do not allow total IRA contributions above the annual limit for 2025: $7,000, or $8,000 if age 50 or older (Pub. 590‑A draft for 2025).
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – adjustments overview; Publication 590-A (2025 draft) – IRA contribution & eligibility basics

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Treat contributions as belonging to a tax year only when designated properly; otherwise default to the tax year in which paid, per IRA contribution rules.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – adjustments overview; Publication 590-A (2025 draft) – IRA contribution & eligibility basics

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Require earned compensation for IRA contribution eligibility, except in cases allowed by law (e.g., spousal IRA on a joint return).
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – adjustments overview; Publication 590-A (2025 draft) – IRA contribution & eligibility basics

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Flag potential Roth IRA contribution phaseout based on modified AGI; require modified AGI computation when Roth contributions exist.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – adjustments overview; Publication 590-A (2025 draft) – IRA contribution & eligibility basics

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Flag potential traditional IRA deduction limitations when taxpayer or spouse is covered by a retirement plan at work; require coverage indicator.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – adjustments overview; Publication 590-A (2025 draft) – IRA contribution & eligibility basics

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Track recharacterizations and conversions separately from regular contributions, and apply reporting requirements.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – adjustments overview; Publication 590-A (2025 draft) – IRA contribution & eligibility basics

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Validate rollovers: treat timely trustee-to-trustee transfers as non-taxable rollovers; require rollover coding on 1099-R input.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – adjustments overview; Publication 590-A (2025 draft) – IRA contribution & eligibility basics

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Disallow deduction for excess contributions unless corrected as allowed; calculate excise tax flags when excess remains.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – adjustments overview; Publication 590-A (2025 draft) – IRA contribution & eligibility basics

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Require beneficiary and required minimum distribution (RMD) indicators for post‑retirement distributions (handled under Pub. 590‑B, not fully enumerated here).
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – adjustments overview; Publication 590-A (2025 draft) – IRA contribution & eligibility basics

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Generate Form 8606 triggers when nondeductible contributions or Roth conversions are present.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – adjustments overview; Publication 590-A (2025 draft) – IRA contribution & eligibility basics

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Allow deduction of travel expenses only when ordinary, necessary, and incurred while traveling away from the taxpayer’s tax home for business (Pub. 463).
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – business income overview; Publication 463 (2025 draft) – travel/vehicle substantiation and limits

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Require contemporaneous substantiation for travel, meals, gifts, and listed property as applicable (Pub. 463 recordkeeping).
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – business income overview; Publication 463 (2025 draft) – travel/vehicle substantiation and limits

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Disallow commuting costs between home and regular work location as business mileage; treat it as personal commuting.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – business income overview; Publication 463 (2025 draft) – travel/vehicle substantiation and limits

Business_Rule_Plain_English: If standard mileage method is used, prevent simultaneous depreciation deductions that are not allowed under that method (apply method consistency checks).
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – business income overview; Publication 463 (2025 draft) – travel/vehicle substantiation and limits

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Require business vs personal use percentage for vehicles; allocate expenses accordingly.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – business income overview; Publication 463 (2025 draft) – travel/vehicle substantiation and limits

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Flag passenger automobile depreciation limitations and apply luxury-auto limits for vehicles placed in service in 2025 (Pub. 463 draft references limits).
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – business income overview; Publication 463 (2025 draft) – travel/vehicle substantiation and limits

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Validate Section 179 election eligibility and enforce the 2025 maximum election cap ($2,500,000) for qualifying property (Pub. 463 draft).
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – business income overview; Publication 463 (2025 draft) – travel/vehicle substantiation and limits

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Require date placed in service and business use >50% tests where needed for certain accelerated depreciation/179 treatments.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – business income overview; Publication 463 (2025 draft) – travel/vehicle substantiation and limits

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Require receipts for lodging and other expenses over substantiation thresholds; store receipt status and image links for audit defense.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – business income overview; Publication 463 (2025 draft) – travel/vehicle substantiation and limits

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Disallow deductions for expenses that were reimbursed under an accountable plan when reimbursement was excluded from income (avoid double benefit).
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – business income overview; Publication 463 (2025 draft) – travel/vehicle substantiation and limits

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Treat all income items as taxable by default unless explicitly identified as excludable under the Code/IRS guidance (store exclusion authority).
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – general rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Separate tax‑exempt interest from taxable interest and ensure tax‑exempt interest still flows into computations where it affects other rules (e.g., some credits).
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – general rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Separate qualified dividends from ordinary dividends; if qualified dividends exist, route to the qualified dividends and capital gain tax worksheet logic.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – general rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: If Schedule D is required, compute net capital gain/loss with proper short‑term/long‑term netting and carryover flags.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – general rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Apply loss limitation workflows: flag capital loss limitation and carryover generation for unused losses.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – general rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Ensure each 1099 form is mapped to the correct income line and withholding bucket; reconcile payer EIN/name for duplicate detection.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – general rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Treat Social Security benefits as potentially taxable; compute taxable portion using the applicable worksheet when benefits are present.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – general rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Treat retirement distributions (1099‑R) as taxable unless a rollover/exclusion code applies; require distribution code mapping.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – general rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Treat scholarships as taxable unless they meet qualified scholarship exclusion rules; separate amounts used for tuition/required fees vs other costs.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – general rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Require state tax refund input only when the taxpayer itemized in the prior year; otherwise default to non-taxable (tax benefit rule flag).
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – general rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Compute self‑employment (SE) tax when net earnings from self-employment exist; also compute the deductible half as an adjustment.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) – schedule 2/other taxes guide

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Trigger additional tax workflows for early distributions from retirement accounts when applicable codes/ages indicate penalties may apply.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) – schedule 2/other taxes guide

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Trigger household employment tax workflow when taxpayer paid household employees above filing thresholds and owes FICA/FUTA.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) – schedule 2/other taxes guide

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Trigger net investment income tax (NIIT) and alternative minimum tax (AMT) assessment as a ‘flag-and-route’ based on income types and thresholds (requires separate modules).
Primary_IRS_Authority: Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) – schedule 2/other taxes guide

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Compute repayment/recapture taxes (e.g., premium tax credit reconciliation) when forms indicate advance credits were received.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) – schedule 2/other taxes guide

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Apply underpayment penalty assessment when estimated tax/withholding is insufficient relative to required annual payment safe harbors (Pub. 505).
Primary_IRS_Authority: Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) – schedule 2/other taxes guide

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Compute interest and late filing/late payment penalties when filing/payment occurs after due date and no exception applies.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) – schedule 2/other taxes guide

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Apply refundable credit limitations and due diligence checks for preparers (EITC/CTC/AOTC) as compliance controls.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) – schedule 2/other taxes guide

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Validate filing status 'single' by checking year-end marital status and household facts; if inconsistent, block filing until corrected.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) (i1040gi.pdf) – filing forms and due date; Publication 17 (2025) – general filing rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: When filing status is 'single', ensure dependent and credit eligibility tests use the rules tied to that status (store status at computation time, not just at intake).
Primary_IRS_Authority: Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) (i1040gi.pdf) – filing forms and due date; Publication 17 (2025) – general filing rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: For traditional IRA activity, enforce contribution-year labeling, track excess contribution carryovers, and compute any excise-tax trigger flags per IRA rules (Pub. 590-A).
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – adjustments overview; Publication 590-A (2025 draft) – IRA contribution & eligibility basics

Business_Rule_Plain_English: For traditional IRA activity, require age as-of-year-end and earned compensation fields because eligibility/limits depend on them (Pub. 590-A).
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – adjustments overview; Publication 590-A (2025 draft) – IRA contribution & eligibility basics

Business_Rule_Plain_English: For Roth IRA activity, enforce contribution-year labeling, track excess contribution carryovers, and compute any excise-tax trigger flags per IRA rules (Pub. 590-A).

Business_Rule_Plain_English: If taxpayer uses an ITIN, require ITIN validity check and document upload; block filing if missing.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – general rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Normalize names exactly as on SSA/IRS records; if mismatch detected, warn about e-file reject risk.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – general rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Collect bank account details for direct deposit only after identity fields are validated; encrypt at rest.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – general rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: If the taxpayer had a major life event (marriage/divorce/death), require event date and supporting documents.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) (i1040gi.pdf) – filing forms and due date; Publication 17 (2025) – general filing rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: If a spouse died during the year, route to qualifying surviving spouse eligibility checks and special signature rules.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Instructions for Form 1040 (2025) (i1040gi.pdf) – filing forms and due date; Publication 17 (2025) – general filing rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: If 1099-INT shows early withdrawal penalty, route penalty amount to adjustments module rather than income.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – general rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: If payer reports foreign tax paid, route to foreign tax credit/ deduction decision module.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – general rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Require acquisition date, sale date, proceeds, and cost basis for each lot; do not accept 'net only' except when IRS permits summaries with statement attachments.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – general rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: If basis is missing, default to 'basis unknown' and flag as high risk; require brokerage statement upload.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – general rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Require property address, days rented, personal use days, and ownership percentage; allocate income/expenses accordingly.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – general rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: If 1099-R indicates rollover, require rollover destination and date to validate tax-free treatment.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – general rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: If student loan interest is claimed, require Form 1098-E amount and modified AGI computation inputs.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – adjustments overview; Publication 590-A (2025 draft) – IRA contribution & eligibility basics

Business_Rule_Plain_English: If SALT deduction is taken, require state/local tax paid details and enforce annual caps applicable for the year.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – general rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: If charitable contributions are claimed, require substantiation level based on contribution type and amount (cash vs noncash).
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – general rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Reconcile withholding across W-2/1099 forms and ensure it is not double-counted when multiple imports occur.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 505 (2025) – withholding and estimated tax (listed on IRS eBooks index)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: If estimated payments exist, require payment dates and amounts; allocate to the correct tax year.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 505 (2025) – withholding and estimated tax (listed on IRS eBooks index)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Maintain a per-rule audit trail: inputs used, computations performed, and outputs generated for defendability.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – general rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Generate a 'missing documents' checklist at intake and update it dynamically as forms are imported.
Primary_IRS_Authority: Publication 17 (2025) – general rules

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Use 2025 basic standard deduction amounts (under current IRS guidance for 2025): Single $15,750; Married Filing Separately $15,750; Married Filing Jointly/Qualifying Surviving Spouse $31,500; Head of Household $23,625, unless an exception rule overrides.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Instructions for Form 1040 and 1040-SR (2025) (i1040gi.pdf)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: If filing status is Married Filing Separately and spouse itemizes deductions, set standard deduction to $0 (cannot take standard deduction).
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Instructions for Form 1040 and 1040-SR (2025) (i1040gi.pdf)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: If taxpayer is a dual-status alien for the year, set standard deduction to $0 and require itemized deductions path (unless an exception applies under IRS guidance).
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Instructions for Form 1040 and 1040-SR (2025) (i1040gi.pdf)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: For a taxpayer who can be claimed as a dependent, compute standard deduction as the greater of $1,350 or ($450 + earned income), subject to the maximum of the basic standard deduction for the taxpayer’s filing status.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Rev. Proc. 2025-32 (inflation adjustments incorporating 2025 law changes)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: For 2025, cap total contributions to all traditional + Roth IRAs at $7,000 (or $8,000 if age 50 or older at year-end), limited further by taxable compensation if lower.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Publication 590-A (2025 draft) (IRAs)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: If taxpayer’s taxable compensation for 2025 is less than $7,000 (or $8,000 if eligible), cap IRA contributions at the compensation amount.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Retirement Topics – IRA contribution limits

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Cap the student loan interest deduction at $2,500 for 2025, before applying any MAGI phaseout rules.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Rev. Proc. 2024-40 (inflation adjustments for 2025 baseline items)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Apply 2025 student loan interest deduction phaseout: begin phasing out when MAGI exceeds $85,000 (Single/HOH/etc.) or $170,000 (MFJ); fully phased out at MAGI $100,000 (Single/HOH/etc.) or $200,000 (MFJ).
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Rev. Proc. 2024-40 (inflation adjustments for 2025 baseline items)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Roth IRA contribution eligibility and phaseout rules depend on MAGI and filing status; compute MAGI per Pub 590-A before allowing a Roth contribution.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Publication 17 (2025) web version

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Traditional IRA deduction may be reduced or eliminated if taxpayer or spouse is covered by an employer plan; enforce coverage indicator before applying deduction limits.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Publication 17 (2025) web version

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Education credits and exclusions often require MAGI-based phaseouts; compute the specific MAGI definition for the selected education benefit.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Publication 17 (2025) web version

Business_Rule_Plain_English: EITC is subject to investment income and earned income limitations; validate both before computing the credit amount.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Publication 17 (2025) web version

Business_Rule_Plain_English: For SALT itemized deduction, enforce the annual cap and prevent claiming disallowed taxes; require state/local payment evidence.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Publication 17 (2025) web version

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Represent phaseouts as a standardized function: (MAGI − phaseout_start) / (phaseout_end − phaseout_start), floored at 0 and capped at 1, then apply to the reducible amount as specified by the credit/deduction’s instructions.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Instructions for Form 1040 and 1040-SR (2025) (i1040gi.pdf)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Store (start, end, filing-status) as constants in a single 2025 limits table, with an audit trail to the IRS authority used; do not hardcode thresholds inside rule text in production.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Instructions for Form 1040 and 1040-SR (2025) (i1040gi.pdf)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Round intermediate phaseout ratios per the worksheet’s instruction (e.g., round to nearest whole dollar at specified steps) to match IRS computations and avoid mismatch notices.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Instructions for Form 1040 and 1040-SR (2025) (i1040gi.pdf)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: If the IRS worksheet requires modified AGI, compute MAGI using the specific add-backs listed for that benefit (do not reuse a generic MAGI unless explicitly allowed).
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Instructions for Form 1040 and 1040-SR (2025) (i1040gi.pdf)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Where an election changes the limitation (e.g., use of prior-year earned income for a credit), store the election flag and compute both paths for validation before finalizing.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Instructions for Form 1040 and 1040-SR (2025) (i1040gi.pdf)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Whenever a phaseout disallows a benefit fully, generate a plain-English explanation and cite the worksheet line references for transparency and audit defense.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Instructions for Form 1040 and 1040-SR (2025) (i1040gi.pdf)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Before applying a dollar limit, validate eligibility gating conditions (filing status, SSN/ITIN requirements, residency tests, age tests, and dependency tests).
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Instructions for Form 1040 and 1040-SR (2025) (i1040gi.pdf)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: If a limit depends on filing status, compute filing status first and lock it for the rest of the computation run to prevent inconsistent downstream results.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Instructions for Form 1040 and 1040-SR (2025) (i1040gi.pdf)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: When the taxpayer could qualify under multiple rules, apply the ordering in the IRS instructions (e.g., compute exclusions first, then deductions, then credits) to avoid double benefits.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Instructions for Form 1040 and 1040-SR (2025) (i1040gi.pdf)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: For each limit-driven benefit, create an evidence checklist (forms, statements, and substantiation records) and mark the return as 'incomplete' until evidence is satisfied.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Instructions for Form 1040 and 1040-SR (2025) (i1040gi.pdf)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Disallow negative amounts for benefits that are defined as nonnegative in IRS worksheets; if inputs are negative, route to an exception review step.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Instructions for Form 1040 and 1040-SR (2025) (i1040gi.pdf)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Use a central constants registry for TY2025 that includes standard deduction, dependent deduction formula, IRA limits, and other annually-adjusted items; enforce versioning by publish date.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Instructions for Form 1040 and 1040-SR (2025) (i1040gi.pdf)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: If IRS issues updated instructions during filing season, record the publish date and re-run computations with the updated constants; log the delta for traceability.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Instructions for Form 1040 and 1040-SR (2025) (i1040gi.pdf)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Any time the computation uses an IRS worksheet, store the worksheet name, inputs, and outputs as a structured JSON artifact for audit defense.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Instructions for Form 1040 and 1040-SR (2025) (i1040gi.pdf)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Prevent double counting by attaching a unique source identifier to every imported form line (payer + form type + box + amount + tax year).
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Instructions for Form 1040 and 1040-SR (2025) (i1040gi.pdf)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: Implement a 'limit conflict detector' that flags when the same income/expense is used to support multiple benefits in a disallowed way.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Instructions for Form 1040 and 1040-SR (2025) (i1040gi.pdf)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: For dependent standard deduction, Store the (start/end/limit) parameters by filing status in the TY2025 constants table and reference them during computation.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Instructions for Form 1040 and 1040-SR (2025) (i1040gi.pdf)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: For IRA MAGI phaseout, Compute the benefit using the IRS worksheet ordering, then apply the limit/phaseout exactly as the worksheet prescribes.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Publication 590-A (2025 draft) (IRAs)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: For student loan interest deduction, Compute the benefit using the IRS worksheet ordering, then apply the limit/phaseout exactly as the worksheet prescribes.

Business_Rule_Plain_English: For dependent standard deduction, Do not let a user override a computed limit without entering a documented IRS-based reason code and attaching supporting documentation.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Instructions for Form 1040 and 1040-SR (2025) (i1040gi.pdf)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: For IRA contribution/deduction, Generate test cases at the limit boundary (just below start, at start, midpoint, at end, just above end) and compare to IRS worksheet examples when available.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Publication 590-A (2025 draft) (IRAs)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: For IRA MAGI phaseout, When the limit eliminates the benefit, output $0 and include an explanation string that states which limit was exceeded.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Publication 590-A (2025 draft) (IRAs)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: For standard deduction, Require the specific input fields needed for the limit (MAGI, earned income, investment income, age, dependency) and block calculation if any are missing.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Instructions for Form 1040 and 1040-SR (2025) (i1040gi.pdf)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: For IRA MAGI phaseout, Compute the benefit using the IRS worksheet ordering, then apply the limit/phaseout exactly as the worksheet prescribes.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Publication 590-A (2025 draft) (IRAs)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: For student loan interest deduction, Store the (start/end/limit) parameters by filing status in the TY2025 constants table and reference them during computation.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Rev. Proc. 2024-40 (inflation adjustments for 2025 baseline items)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: For IRA MAGI phaseout, When the limit eliminates the benefit, output $0 and include an explanation string that states which limit was exceeded.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Publication 590-A (2025 draft) (IRAs)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: For itemized deduction cap/eligibility, When the limit eliminates the benefit, output $0 and include an explanation string that states which limit was exceeded.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Instructions for Form 1040 and 1040-SR (2025) (i1040gi.pdf)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: For standard deduction, Compute the benefit using the IRS worksheet ordering, then apply the limit/phaseout exactly as the worksheet prescribes.

Business_Rule_Plain_English: For education benefit MAGI phaseout, Store the (start/end/limit) parameters by filing status in the TY2025 constants table and reference them during computation.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Publication 17 (2025) web version

Business_Rule_Plain_English: For IRA contribution/deduction, Compute the benefit using the IRS worksheet ordering, then apply the limit/phaseout exactly as the worksheet prescribes.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Publication 590-A (2025 draft) (IRAs)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: For refundable credit limit/eligibility, Store the (start/end/limit) parameters by filing status in the TY2025 constants table and reference them during computation.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Instructions for Form 1040 and 1040-SR (2025) (i1040gi.pdf)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: For IRA contribution/deduction, Do not let a user override a computed limit without entering a documented IRS-based reason code and attaching supporting documentation.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Publication 590-A (2025 draft) (IRAs)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: For standard deduction, Store the (start/end/limit) parameters by filing status in the TY2025 constants table and reference them during computation.
Primary_IRS_Authority: IRS Instructions for Form 1040 and 1040-SR (2025) (i1040gi.pdf)

Business_Rule_Plain_English: For student loan interest deduction, When the limit eliminates the benefit, output $0 and include an explanation string that states which limit was exceeded.
